Abstract: Abdel Ghani, Algerian man arrested in Brooklyn on charges of being part of terrorist bomb plot, is ordered held without bond in court proceeding that offers few new details about suspect or his activities; Ghani's lawyers seek dismissal of charges, contending that specific acts Ghani is accused of did not occur in Manhattan, where charges were filed; prosecutors contend case is properly charged given Ghani's flights into New York and phone calls in jurisdiction; Ghani is accused of being accomplice of Ahmed Ressam, Algerian arrested at Canadian border near Seattle as he tried to bring explosives and bomb components into United States; Ghani's name and phone number were found among Ressam's possessions; prosecutor claims Ghani was in US illegally (M)
Snippet: Abdel Ghani, Algerian man arrested in Brooklyn on charges of being part of terrorist bomb plot, is ordered held without bond in court proceeding that offers few new details about suspect or his activities; Ghani's lawyers seek dismissal of charges...
LeadParagraph: The Algerian man arrested in Brooklyn on charges of being part of a terrorist bomb plot was ordered held without bond yesterday in a court proceeding that otherwise offered few new details about the suspect or his activities.

Headline.Main: Brooklyn Man Charged in Terror Plot Is Held Without Bond
Headline.PrintHeadline: Brooklyn Man Charged in Terror Plot Is Held Without Bond
